abstract.text: An object that reads sample references from an asset track.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Apps can extract information about the location of samples in a track — the file URL and offset — by adding an instance of this class to an asset reader. Read the
attachments on the extracted sample buffers to get the location of the sample data.
You can also append sample buffers that you extract using this class to an
instance to create movie tracks that aren’t self-contained and reference data in the original file instead. To write tracks that aren’t self-contained, use instances of
that you configure to write files of type
Because this output doesn’t return sample data, it ignores the value of the

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that reads media data from an asset.
An object that reads audio samples that result from mixing audio from one or more tracks.
An abstract class that defines the interface to read media samples from an asset reader.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the output vends copied sample data.
An object that creates timed metadata group objects for an asset track.
An object that reads sample references from an asset track.
Returns a new object that supplies sample references.
Creates an object that supplies sample references.
The track from which the output reads sample references.
An object that reads media data from a single track of an asset.
An object that reads composited video frames from one or more tracks of an asset.
An object that writes media data to a container file.
An object that appends media samples to a track in an asset writer’s output file.
The UTI for the QuickTime movie file format.
Render single images for the left eye and right eye from a multiview High Efficiency Video Coding format file by reading individual video frames.
Indicates the byte offset at which the sample data begins (type `CFNumber`).
Indicates the URL where the sample data is (type `CFURL`).
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
